definition: insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near

sentences.english: I neither complain for lacking money nor hostile to riches and honour.
sentences.chinese: 淡薄名利，寧靜致遠，既不抱怨貧賤又不仇視富貴。

sentences.english: The memory of his life on Earth was falling away.
sentences.chinese: 他對塵世生活的記憶已經開始淡薄了。

sentences.english: In Chinese traditional society, private loyalty is intense, but Public loyalty is dim.
sentences.chinese: 中國傳統社會私忠觀念強烈而公忠觀念淡薄。

sentences.english: In stead, an occasional greeting spreads our longings far beyond.
sentences.chinese: 彼此偶遇時一聲問候淺笑，雖看似淡薄卻是情深意長。

sentences.english: He is too earnest in a political culture that is pervasively cynical.
sentences.chinese: 在人情淡薄的政治舞臺上，他顯得過於認真。

sentences.english: The color printing ink shallow little weak.
sentences.chinese: 淺處油墨少印出的色調淡薄。

sentences.english: The objective one is that the system for collecting tax is imperfect and the legal knowledge is poor.
sentences.chinese: 客觀因素是稅收制度不健全，法制觀念淡薄等。

sentences.english: The memory of his childhood darkened with age.
sentences.chinese: 隨着年歲的增長，他對童年的記憶逐漸淡薄了。

definition: to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
dense/thick (fog, clouds etc)/to have a strong interest in/deep/fully saturated (color)
cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect
